column4: i just marked mozilla-firefox for reinstallation in synaptic, which completed succesfully...however, when i opened firefox and went to help/about it list version 1.0.2...what's wrong?
i think that's what version installs from synaptic
how do i get up to version 1.5.1?
i got it using automatix...which i now know to be a no-no, so don't do it!
no bggie...so you're saying just live with 1.0.2?
read the PM you just got from ubotu

no offense, but what am i supposed to do with "niki wants you to know: well, firefox is a Free Software web browser that supports extensions and is gaining popularity by the hour. Developed by the Mozilla Foundation. For firefox 1.5, look at !firefox1.5  To use your mouse theme in firefox, see http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=78961"
you could start by reading it and following it's directions
it's about using a mouse theme in firefox...what's that got to do with apt-get install of latest firefox version?
read the new one you just got from ubotu
OK, well now that's a different animal...however, i use hoary...will the info still apply to the release i use?
my bf is very sick, i'm gonna have to sign out...i'm sure one of the fine folks in here will help you out :)
